title: Man charged with murder in shooting death of Fairfield teen
content:
A Fairfield man was arrested this morning in connection with the shooting death of a Fairfield teen.
Courtline Griffin, 22, was booked into the Jefferson County Jail shortly before 9 a.m., jail records show. He is charged with murder in the June 19 slaying of 17-year-old Arrico Eatmon.
Fairfield police responded just before 5:30 p.m. that Sunday to a report of a shooting in the 5500 block of Avenue D. Fairfield police Chief Nick Dyer said Eatmon was in front of a home when the gunfire rang out.
Eatmon was taken to UAB Medical Center West, where he was pronounced dead at 6:44 p.m.
Fairfield police Chief Nick Dyer said Griffin was questioned in the slaying last week. Officers went to his Fairfield home about 6:15 a.m. today to serve the official arrest warrant. He was taken into custody without incident.
Investigators haven't released a motive but said there was a lot of gunfire exchanged that day. It wasn't immediately clear whether Eatmon was the intended target.
Griffin is being held on $60.000 bond.
